fact: After completing Happiness is a Warm Spaceship,
Junlei Tennyson will mention that Edna Ingmire has something which she could use the Stranger's help with.
Edna will explain that the Groundbreaker is about to lose its communications capabilities,
as its primary communications relay is about to be occluded by one of Halcyon's gas giants for the next few months.
Unfortunately, the only backup auxiliary relay within orbital range went offline months ago,
and Groundbreaker cannot spare any people for maintenance.
Offering to help get the station back online starts the quest.
Edna will also give the Stranger a Relay Diagnostics Manual to help them diagnose the problem with the station
and asks them to retrieve a copy of the relay's backup data so she can forward any messages from Earth stored in the memory.
The terminal to activate the relay is located inside the central control room of the relay station.
Each relay transmitter maintains a backup of messages it has received but not yet transmitted.
Since the relay has been off-line for some time,
the log of backup messages should be quite substantial.
Loot the Keycard from the corpse and use it on the terminal to activate the Relay.
Edna is in the Communications Control Room in Engineering.
Return to Groundbreaker and give Edna the data.
She will provide a reward of 1,500 bits,
completing the quest.
Alexander J. Frey is a man whose body can be found on Relay GB-23.
Alexander Frey was a man who lived in Byzantium who began hearing strange voices inside his head.
The voices told him to "help" the people he saw by killing them,
and he began having dreams about murder,
including one where he strangled his work supervisor, Delilah, to death.
He fled Byzantium,
believing that he would be locked up,
after he once confessed his thoughts to an old friend.
He took refuge on Relay GB-23,
bringing with him enough supplies to last decades.
In an attempt to stop the whispers in his head,
he deactivated the relay station's transmitter relay,
creating a risk to Groundbreaker's communications capabilities when their primary comms relay experienced an occlusion event.
Unfortunately, deactivating the transmitter failed to stop the voices in Frey's head.
This led him to committing suicide to end the whispers once and for all.
Edna Ingmire is an engineer on Groundbreaker.
Edna is friends with Gladys Culkelly and occasionally passes on transmissions that she thinks Gladys may find interesting.
For all her good judgment when it comes to identifying transmissions of interest,
this does not translate when it comes to men.
UDL-001 The Groundbreaker or simply Groundbreaker was the first colony ship to arrive in Halcyon during the Crossing.
By 2355, it has been converted into an independent orbital station,
and is the only place in the entire Halcyon system that is not controlled by the Halcyon Holdings Corporate Board or any other corporation.
The crew of the Groundbreaker is fiercely protective of their independence from the corporations,
and the corporations value the station's role as a thriving freeport enough that they are willing to deal with it on relatively equal terms.
In practical terms, while the Groundbreaker rules itself,
it cooperates with the corporations to an extent,
such as by impounding ships that the Board happens to flag.
The Groundbreaker is commanded by engineer-turned-captain Junlei Tennyson.
Udom Bedford is the Halcyon Holdings Corporation representative stationed aboard.
According to Junlei, lots of corners were cut when the ship was built,
prompting Captain Guiying Tennyson to spend half of her career attempting to patch the ship back together after the Crossing from Earth to Halcyon.
In addition, the ship has tinkerings and bypasses that only the Tennysons know about.
The Groundbreaker maintains a somewhat tense relationship with the Board,
owing to their declared independence from Board authority,
as well as their control of shipping routes outward from the Halcyon System.
Nonetheless, given that Groundbreaker lacks any semblance of military might against the Board beyond the mardets stationed aboard the ship,
the loose hierarchy in charge of the Groundbreaker often seeks to find (illicit) ways of delaying, stymieing, or pitting corporations under the Board's thumb against each other,
usually through black market fences like Gladys Culkelly.
Nonetheless, the Board maintains an embassy aboard the Groundbreaker run by bureaucrat Udom Bedford.
Depending on the actions of the Stranger, the Groundbreaker's crew may be compelled to rebel against the Board's system-wide authority.
The Groundbreaker is generally neutral to Sublight Salvage and Shipping Corporation,
and allows them to operate an office and warehouse aboard the ship, helmed by Lilya Hagen.
Halcyon, also called the Halcyon Colony, or simply the Colony,
is a star system on the fringe of known space.
It is part of the Halcyon Cluster,
so named because Halcyon itself is the brightest star in the cluster when viewed from Earth.
Halcyon is proudly advertised as the only system entirely owned and operated by corporations.
Most of the planets in the system are named after locations, deities, or creatures from Greek mythology.
Junlei Tennyson is a self described engineer-turned-captain and is the leader of Groundbreaker,
the only community in Halcyon operating outside The Board's control.
She harbours a strong dislike for the Board due to their continued attempts to exert control over Groundbreaker,
and because she believes they are only after two things—bits and power—which they get by sticking their nose where it doesn't belong.
She considers the Mardets, crew, and engineers of Groundbreaker to be family.
Junlei Tennyson is the third generation of Tennyson leadership aboard Groundbreaker,
recently promoted from chief engineer to captain after the death of her mother.
She was close to her mother but frequently argued with her father over how Groundbreaker should be run.
Junlei was previously in a relationship with a woman named Isabelle who tried and failed to earn the approval of Junlei's father.
They continued seeing each other anyway,
but the relationship eventually ended poorly.
Junlei can be found in her office in Groundbreaker Engineering.
She introduces herself to the Stranger as captain of Groundbreaker,
and notes that her friends call her Chief.
The explanation she gives for the formal introduction is that Groundbreaker doesn't see many visitors.
Junlei then goes on to make it clear that she has the final say on the ship,
and welcomes the Stranger on board as they seem to be different to the usual outsiders who are mostly 'Board spies and corporate sprats'.
If the player asks Junlei about the heat problem on Groundbreaker,
they can offer to help her obtain new radiator parts.
After the radiator parts are installed,
more dialogue options become available to ask her about herself and Groundbreaker.
She will also direct the player to Edna Ingmire to help her with a comms issue,
and inform the player that they are now authorized to trade with Doctor Mfuru.
Junlei will appear on the Unreliable if the player helps to set up a date between her and Parvati.
When interacted with, she thanks them for welcoming her aboard the ship.
Relay GB-23 is one of Groundbreaker's backup auxiliary communications relay stations,
located in Halcyon.
Like other relay stations,
Relay GB-23 orbits the edge of the Halcyon system and therefore receives a significant proportion of the transmissions from Earth.

Relay GB-23 went offline some months ago for unknown reasons and Edna Ingmire on Groundbreaker has so far been unsuccessful in arranging for a diagnostic expedition to the station to get it back online,
as Junlei Tennyson keeps denying the personnel loss allocation associated with sending a technical team to the station.
Edna asks the Stranger to assist with getting the relay back online.
The transmitter array on the station was manually deactivated by Alexander Frey,
a resident of Byzantium who fled to the station after being plagued with mysterious voices in his head.
He powered down the transmitter as he believed it to be the source of the voices.
This was not the case and the voices persisted even after deactivating the relay,
driving him mad and eventually causing him to commit suicide.
The Halcyon Holdings Corporate Board, also simply known as The Board,
institutes policy and law throughout the Halcyon Colony.
The details surrounding the board's founding remain largely unknown,
though its activities suggest that it was originally founded some seventy-odd years ago, give or take.
In that time, it has managed to terraform Terra I
(a catastrophic failure due to mutations rendering the wildlife overwhelmingly hostile to human life).
The Board maintains a very tense relationship with MSI, owing to MSI's democratic ideals and their declared ownership of Monarch.

As a result, the Board has placed Monarch, and by extension, MSI, under the Hazard Clause, which forbids off-world businesses from doing transactions on Monarch without the correct (and deliberately impossible to complete) documents.
Depending on the actions of the Stranger, MSI may be compelled to rebel against the Board's authoritarianism.
